heading: Today
text: Any morning sun east giving way to clouds.  A period of showers north late morning and early afternoon, then rain in Quebec, spreading south to the Adirondacks mid-afternoon and Rt. 4 late.  Highs in the 40s, some 50s southwest.  Light winds, becoming south near 10 mph, gusting to 25 mph in the afternoon.

heading: Tonight
text: Rain this evening south, tapering to showers.  Rain north, mixing or changing to snow, a trace to 2 inches, mostly over the higher elevations.  Lows in the upper 20s to mid 30s.  Winds shifting to the northwest 10 to 25 mph, gusting 35 to 50 mph after midnight.

heading: Thursday
text: Morning snow or rain showers north, south through the mountains, tapering off.  Increasing sun late morning and afternoon in NY and south of Rt. 2.  Windy and colder.  Highs in the 30s to low 40s north, in the 40s south.  Winds northwest 10 to 25 mph, gusting 35 to 50 mph, decreasing in the afternoon.
